title: Euro 2022: England show credentials after passing true test
description: England's quarter-final victory over Spain at Euro 2022 has all the classic ingredients of tournament football.

title: Pesticide made us sterile, banana workers say
description: US companies are accused of having used a pesticide in Latin America even though its health risks were known.

title: Germany scrambles for energy with no faith in Russian gas
description: Moscow has in effect weaponised gas exports, so Germany is having to restart old coal-fired power stations.

title: Watch all the angles of Georgia Stanway’s screamer
description: Georgia Stanway puts England ahead against Spain with a screamer in their Euro 2022 quarter-final at Brighton's Amex Stadium.

title: Somalia drought: ‘I remember at least five children died’
description: Fardhosa is just 13 years old but has lived through three droughts in her life and never had a proper meal.

title: Daisy Edgar-Jones on her Hollywood debut
description: Normal People star Daisy Edgar-Jones is making her Hollywood debut in Where the Crawdads Sing.

title: The allotment firms helping to trim long waiting lists
description: As people have to wait years to get a council allotment, private firms are offering an alternative.

title: Killed for blasphemy in Nigeria: 'It felt like a spear pierced my heart'
description: Twelve states in Nigeria's north have Islamic courts that view blasphemy as an offence punishable by death.

title: Euro 2022: Leah Williamson never felt England were going out against Spain
description: England captain Leah Williamson says she never thought they were going to lose to Spain despite needing an 84th-minute equaliser and extra-time winner to reach the Euro 2022 semi-finals.

title: Check your postcode: Is your area vulnerable to extreme heat?
description: With Britain reaching record temperatures, use our postcode tool to find out how your area experiences extreme heat.

title: Euro 2022: Uefa reports 290 abusive posts to social media companies following group stage
description: Uefa reports 290 cases of online abuse to social media companies, with England among the teams most targeted.

title: EU told to prepare for Russian gas shut-off
description: Countries urged to cut use by 15% until March, with the target becoming mandatory if Russia halts supplies.

title: Henrik Stenson removed as Europe's Ryder Cup captain
description: Henrik Stenson is removed as Europe's Ryder Cup captain with immediate effect.

title: London Fire Brigade had busiest day since World War Two, says London mayor
description: Fifteen areas across the UK declared major incidents as wildfires broke out after unprecedented heat.

title: Inflation: Fuel, milk and eggs push prices up at fastest rate in 40 years
description: The prices of fuel and food climbed in June, latest figures show.

title: Wildfires rage in Greece, Spain and Italy as heatwave moves across Europe

title: Trains cancelled and delayed after heatwave damage

title: EuroMillions: UK ticket-holder wins record £195m jackpot
description: A lucky ticket-holder matches seven numbers to become the biggest National Lottery winner of all time.

title: Apple settles US butterfly-keyboard legal action for $50m
description: Apple will pay $50m (£41.6m) over claims its laptop keyboards were unresponsive and unreliable.

title: Sri Lanka: Ranil Wickremesinghe elected president

description: Geoff Wightman has been commentating on his son Jake's races for 18 years, but Tuesday's victory was the most special yet.
